content.paragraph:
openmw.coredefines functions and types that are available in local,
global and menu scripts.

The revision of OpenMW Lua API. #ContentFiles: functions working with the list of currently loaded content files. #Dialogue: Dialogue #Factions: Factions Construct FormId string from content file name and the index in the file. Get a GMST setting from content files. Game time in seconds. The scale of game time relative to simulation time. Frame duration in seconds. Real time in seconds; starting point is not fixed (can be time since last reboot), use only for measuring intervals. Simulation time in seconds. The scale of simulation time relative to real time. Whether the world is paused (onUpdate doesn't work when the world is paused). Return l10n formatting function for the given context. #Magic: spells and spell effects Terminates the game and quits to the OS. Send an event to global scripts. #Sound: Sounds and Speech #Stats: stats
Optional attribute ID Optional skill ID Effect id string current magnitude of the effect. Will be set to 0 when effect is removed or expires. Localized name of the effect

A number uniquely identifying this active spell within the affected actor's list of active spells. If set, this spell affects the base values of affected stats, rather than modifying current values. The caster object, or nil if the spell has no defined caster The active effects (#ActiveSpellEffect) of this spell. If set, this spell is tied to an equipped item and can only be ended by unequipping the item. Record id of the spell or item used to cast the spell The enchanted item used to cast the spell, or nil if the spell was not cast from an enchanted item. Note that if the spell was cast for a single-use enchantment such as a scroll, this will be nil. The spell or item display name If set, this spell can be applied multiple times. If not set, the same spell can only be applied once from the same source (where source is determined by caster + item). In vanilla rules, consumables are stackable while spells and enchantments are not. If set, this spell effect is temporary and should end on its own. Either after a single application or after its duration has run out.

Optional attribute ID Optional skill ID Total duration in seconds of this spell effect, should not be confused with remaining duration. Or nil if the effect is not temporary. Remaining duration in seconds of this spell effect, or nil if the effect is not temporary. Magic effect id Index of this effect within the original list of#MagicEffectWithParamsof the spell/enchantment/potion this effect came from. The magnitude of the effect in the current frame. This will be a new random number between minMagnitude and maxMagnitude every frame. Or nil if the effect has no magnitude. The maximum magnitude of this effect, or nil if the effect has no magnitude. The minimum magnitude of this effect, or nil if the effect has no magnitude. Localized name of the effect

Returns a read-only#AttributeRecord A read-only list of all#AttributeRecords in the world database, may be indexed by recordId.
Implementsiterables#Listof #AttributeRecord.
Human-readable description VFS path to the icon Record id Human-readable name

Get all objects of given type from the cell; Only available from global scripts. Index of the cell by X (only for exteriors). Index of the cell by Y (only for exteriors). True if in this cell sky should be rendered. Returns true if the cell has given tag. True if the cell contains water. Unique record ID of the cell, based on cell name for interiors and the worldspace for exteriors, or the formID of the cell for ESM4 cells. Whether the cell is an exterior cell. "Exterior" means grid of cells where the player can seamless walk from one cell to another without teleports. QuasiExterior (interior with sky) is not an exterior. Returns true either if the cell contains the object or if the cell is an exterior and the object is also in an exterior. (DEPRECATED, usehasTag("QuasiExterior")) Whether the cell is a quasi exterior (like interior but with the sky and the wheather).
Name of the cell (can be empty string). Region of the cell. The water level of the cell. (nil if cell has no water). Id of the world space.
Check if the content file with given name present in the load order. Return the index of a specific content file in the load order (ornilif there is no such content file).
The current load order (list of content file names).

#DialogueRecordsfunctions for greeting read-only records. #DialogueRecordsfunctions for journal (quest) read-only records. #DialogueRecordsfunctions for persuasion read-only records. #DialogueRecordsfunctions for topic read-only records. #DialogueRecordsfunctions for voice read-only records.

Record identifier A read-only list containing all#DialogueRecordInfos for this record, in order. Same as id, but with upper cases preserved. Non-nil only for journal records with available value. Holds the quest name for this journal entry. Same info may be available underinfos[1].textas well, but this variable is made for convenience.

Speaker class allowing for this info entry to appear. Minimum speaker disposition allowing for this info entry to appear. Faction of which the speaker must be a member for this info entry to appear. Minimum speaker's rank in their faction allowing for this info entry to appear. Speaker gender allowing for this info entry to appear: "male" or "female". Speaker ID allowing for this info entry to appear. Speaker race allowing for this info entry to appear. Cell name prefix of location where the player must be for this info entry to appear. Faction of which the player must be a member for this info entry to appear. Minimum player's rank in their faction allowing for this info entry to appear. Identifier for this info entry. Is unique only within the#DialogueRecordit belongs to. True if this info entry has the "Finished" flag checked. True if this info entry has the "Quest Name" flag checked. True if this info entry has the "Restart" flag checked. Quest stage (same as inopenmw_types#PlayerQuest.stage) this info entry is associated with. MWScript (full script text) executed when this info is chosen. Sound file path for this info entry. Text associated with this info entry.
A read-only list of all#DialogueRecords in the world database, may be indexed by recordId, which doesn't have to be lowercase.
Map from#MagicEffectIdto#MagicEffect

If set, the casting cost should be computed based on the effect list rather than read from the cost field Charge capacity. Should not be confused with current charge. The effects (#MagicEffectWithParams) of the enchantment Enchantment id #EnchantmentType

Enchantment is cast on strike, if there is enough charge. Enchantment is cast when used, if there is enough charge. Enchantment can be cast once, destroying the enchanted item. Enchantment is always active when equipped.
A read-only list of all#Enchantmentrecords in the world database, may be indexed by recordId.

Attributes values required to get this rank. Reaction of faction members if player is in this faction. Secondary skill value required to get this rank. Faction name Rank display name Primary skill value required to get this rank.

A read-only list containing IDs of attributes to advance ranks in the faction. If true, the faction won't show in the player's skills menu Faction id Faction name A read-only list containing data for all ranks in the faction, in order. A read-only map containing reactions of other factions to this faction. A read-only list containing IDs of skills to advance ranks in the faction.
A read-only list of all#FactionRecords in the world database.
Activate the object. Add new local script to the object. The cell where the object currently is. During loading a game and for objects in an inventory or a containercellis nil.

Lower cased file name of the content file that defines this object; nil for dynamically created objects. Count (>1 means a stack of objects). Whether the object is enabled or disabled. Global scripts can set the value. Items in containers or inventories can't be disabled. The axis aligned bounding box in world coordinates. Global Variable associated with this object(read only). Whether a script with given path is attached to this object. A unique id of this object (not record id), can be used as a key in a table. Does the object still exist and is available. Moves object into a container or an inventory. Ownership information Container or actor that contains (or has in inventory) this object. It is nil if the object is in a cell. Object position. Returns record ID of the object in lowercase. Removes an object or reduces a stack of objects. Removes script that was attached byaddScriptCan be called only from a global script.

Object rotation. Object scale. Send local event to the object. Sets the object's scale. Splits a stack of items. The object original position The object original rotation Moves object to given cell and position. Type of the object (one of the tables from the packageopenmw.types#types).

The number of items with given recordId. Get first item with given recordId from the inventory. Get all items with given recordId from the inventory. Get all items of given type from the inventory. Checks if the inventory has a resolved item list. Will resolve the inventory, filling it with levelled items if applicable, making its contents permanent.
Possible#MagicEffectIdvalues Possible#EnchantmentTypevalues Possible#SpellRangevalues Possible#SpellTypevalues #Effects: Magic Effects #Enchantments: Enchantments #Spells: Spells

Identifier of the sound used for AOE spells Identifier of the vfx static used for AOE spells Identifier of the projectile used for ranged spells Identifier of the projectile sound used for ranged spells Identifier of the sound used for casting Identifier of the vfx static used for casting If set, it is implied the magic effect links back to the caster in some way and should end immediately or never be applied if the caster dies or is not an actor. Whether the magic effect's vfx should loop or not If set, the effect is considered harmful and should elicit a hostile reaction from affected NPCs. If set, the magic effect has a duration. As an example, divine intervention has no duration while fire damage does. If set, the magic effect depends on a magnitude. As an example, cure common disease has no magnitude while chameleon does. Identifier of the sound used on hit Identifier of the vfx static used on hit Effect Icon Path Effect ID If set, the magic effect is applied fully on cast, rather than being continuously applied over the effect's duration. For example, chameleon is applied once, while fire damage is continuously applied for the duration. Localized name of the effect If set, this effect cannot be re-applied until it has ended. This is used by bound equipment spells. Identifier of the particle texture Skill ID that is this effect's school

Faction who owns the object (nil if missing). Global and self scripts can set the value. Rank required to be allowed to pick up the object (nilif any rank is allowed). Global and self scripts can set the value.
NPC who owns the object (nil if missing). Global and self scripts can set the value.

Returns a read-only#SkillRecord A read-only list of all#SkillRecords in the world database, may be indexed by recordId.
Implementsiterables#Listof #SkillRecord.

The id of the skill's governing attribute Human-readable description VFS path to the icon Record id Human-readable name Optional magic school Table of the 4 possible skill gain values. SeeSkillProgression#SkillUseType. Skill specialization. Either combat, magic, or stealth.

Checks if sound system is enabled (any functions to play sounds are no-ops when it is disabled). Check if an animated voiceover is playing Check if sound file is playing on given object Check if sound is playing on given object Play a 3D sound, attached to object In local scripts can be used only on self. Play a 3D sound file, attached to object In local scripts can be used only on self. List of all#SoundRecords. Play an animated voiceover. Stop an animated voiceover In local scripts can be used only on self. Stop a 3D sound, attached to object In local scripts can be used only on self. Stop a 3D sound file, attached to object In local scripts can be used only on self.
Normalized path to sound file in VFS Sound id Raw maximal range value, from 0 to 255 Raw minimal range value, from 0 to 255 Raw sound volume, from 0 to 255

If set, the spell should ignore skill checks and always succeed. If set, the casting cost should be computed based on the effect list rather than read from the cost field The effects (#MagicEffectWithParams) of the spell Spell id Spell name If set, the spell can be selected as a player's starting spell. #SpellType
Applied on self Ranged spell On touch
Innate ability, always in effect Blight disease Curse Common disease Power, can be used once a day Normal spell, must be cast and costs mana
List of all#Spells.
#Attributefunctions #Skillfunctions
If true, adjust destination position to the ground. New rotation; if missing, then the current rotation is used.

The revision of OpenMW Lua API. It is an integer that is incremented every time the API is changed. See the actual value at the top of the page. #ContentFiles: functions working with the list of currently loaded content files. #Dialogue: Dialogue #Factions: Factions Construct FormId string from content file name and the index in the file. In ESM3 games (e.g. Morrowind) FormIds are used to reference game objects.
In ESM4 games (e.g. Skyrim) FormIds are used both for game objects and as record ids.
#string contentFile:
#number index:
#string:

content.code:
-- In ESM3 content files (e.g. Morrowind) ids are human-readable strings
obj.owner.factionId = 'blades'
-- In ESM4 (e.g. Skyrim) ids should be constructed using `core.getFormId`:
obj.owner.factionId = core.getFormId('Skyrim.esm', 0x72834)

-- In ESM3 content files (e.g. Morrowind) ids are human-readable strings
obj.owner.factionId = 'blades'
-- In ESM4 (e.g. Skyrim) ids should be constructed using `core.getFormId`:
obj.owner.factionId = core.getFormId('Skyrim.esm', 0x72834)

content.paragraph: Get a GMST setting from content files.

#string setting: 
Setting name
#any: Game time in seconds.
#number: The scale of game time relative to simulation time.
#number: Frame duration in seconds. Not available in global scripts.
#number: Real time in seconds; starting point is not fixed (can be time since last reboot), use only for measuring intervals. For Unix time useos.time().
#number: Simulation time in seconds. The number of simulation seconds passed in the game world since starting a new game.
#number: The scale of simulation time relative to real time.
#number: Whether the world is paused (onUpdate doesn't work when the world is paused).

#boolean: Return l10n formatting function for the given context. Localisation files (containing the message names and translations) should be stored in
VFS as files of the forml10n/<ContextName>/<Locale>.yaml.

SeeLocalisationfor details of the localisation file structure. When calling the l10n formatting function, if no localisation can be found for any of the requested locales then
the message key will be returned instead (and formatted, if possible).
This makes it possible to use the source strings as message identifiers. If you do not use the source string as a message identifier you should instead make certain to include
a fallback locale with a complete set of messages.

#string context: 
l10n context; recommended to use the name of the mod.

content.code: This must match the <ContextName> directory in the VFS which stores the localisation files.
This must match the <ContextName> directory in the VFS which stores the localisation files.

content.paragraph:
#string fallbackLocale: 
The source locale containing the default messages
#function:

content.code:
-- Usage in Lua
local myMsg = core.l10n('MyMod', 'en')
print( myMsg('good_morning') )
print( myMsg('you_have_arrows', {count=5}) )
print( myMsg('Hello {name}!', {name='World'}) )

-- Usage in Lua
local myMsg = core.l10n('MyMod', 'en')
print( myMsg('good_morning') )
print( myMsg('you_have_arrows', {count=5}) )
print( myMsg('Hello {name}!', {name='World'}) )

content.paragraph: #Magic: spells and spell effects Terminates the game and quits to the OS. Should be used only for testing purposes. Send an event to global scripts. Note: in menu scripts, errors if the game is not running (checkopenmw.menu#menu.getState)
#string eventName:
eventData:
#Sound: Sounds and Speech #Stats: stats
Optional attribute ID Optional skill ID Effect id string current magnitude of the effect. Will be set to 0 when effect is removed or expires. Localized name of the effect

A number uniquely identifying this active spell within the affected actor's list of active spells. If set, this spell affects the base values of affected stats, rather than modifying current values. The caster object, or nil if the spell has no defined caster The active effects (#ActiveSpellEffect) of this spell. If set, this spell is tied to an equipped item and can only be ended by unequipping the item. Record id of the spell or item used to cast the spell The enchanted item used to cast the spell, or nil if the spell was not cast from an enchanted item. Note that if the spell was cast for a single-use enchantment such as a scroll, this will be nil. The spell or item display name If set, this spell can be applied multiple times. If not set, the same spell can only be applied once from the same source (where source is determined by caster + item). In vanilla rules, consumables are stackable while spells and enchantments are not. If set, this spell effect is temporary and should end on its own. Either after a single application or after its duration has run out.

Optional attribute ID Optional skill ID Total duration in seconds of this spell effect, should not be confused with remaining duration. Or nil if the effect is not temporary. Remaining duration in seconds of this spell effect, or nil if the effect is not temporary. Magic effect id Index of this effect within the original list of#MagicEffectWithParamsof the spell/enchantment/potion this effect came from. The magnitude of the effect in the current frame. This will be a new random number between minMagnitude and maxMagnitude every frame. Or nil if the effect has no magnitude. The maximum magnitude of this effect, or nil if the effect has no magnitude. The minimum magnitude of this effect, or nil if the effect has no magnitude. Localized name of the effect

A cell of the game world.
Get all objects of given type from the cell; Only available from global scripts.

type: 
(optional) object type (seeopenmw.types#types)
#ObjectList:

content.code:
local type = require('openmw.types')
local all = cell:getAll()
local weapons = cell:getAll(types.Weapon)

local type = require('openmw.types')
local all = cell:getAll()
local weapons = cell:getAll(types.Weapon)

content.paragraph: Index of the cell by X (only for exteriors). Index of the cell by Y (only for exteriors). True if in this cell sky should be rendered. Returns true if the cell has given tag.

#string tag: 
One of "QuasiExterior", "NoSleep".

#boolean: True if the cell contains water. Unique record ID of the cell, based on cell name for interiors and the worldspace for exteriors, or the formID of the cell for ESM4 cells. Whether the cell is an exterior cell. "Exterior" means grid of cells where the player can seamless walk from one cell to another without teleports. QuasiExterior (interior with sky) is not an exterior. Returns true either if the cell contains the object or if the cell is an exterior and the object is also in an exterior.
#GameObjectobject:
#boolean:

content.code:
if obj1.cell:isInSameSpace(obj2) then
    dist = (obj1.position - obj2.position):length()
else
    -- the distance can't be calculated because the coordinates are in different spaces
end

if obj1.cell:isInSameSpace(obj2) then
    dist = (obj1.position - obj2.position):length()
else
    -- the distance can't be calculated because the coordinates are in different spaces
end

content.paragraph: (DEPRECATED, usehasTag("QuasiExterior")) Whether the cell is a quasi exterior (like interior but with the sky and the wheather).
Name of the cell (can be empty string). Region of the cell. The water level of the cell. (nil if cell has no water). Id of the world space.

#DialogueRecordsfunctions for greeting read-only records.

content.code:
--print ids of all greeting records
for _, greetingRecord in pairs(core.dialogue.greeting.records) do
    print(greetingRecord.id)
end

--print ids of all greeting records
for _, greetingRecord in pairs(core.dialogue.greeting.records) do
    print(greetingRecord.id)
end

--print all NPC lines for "greeting 0"
for idx, greetingInfo in pairs(core.dialogue.greeting.records["greeting 0"].infos) do
    print(idx, greetingInfo.text)
end

--print all NPC lines for "greeting 0"
for idx, greetingInfo in pairs(core.dialogue.greeting.records["greeting 0"].infos) do
    print(idx, greetingInfo.text)
end

content.paragraph: #DialogueRecordsfunctions for journal (quest) read-only records.

content.code:
--print the name of the record, which is a capitalized version of its id
print(core.dialogue.journal.records["ms_fargothring"].name) -- MS_FargothRing

--print the name of the record, which is a capitalized version of its id
print(core.dialogue.journal.records["ms_fargothring"].name) -- MS_FargothRing

--print ids of all journal records
for _, journalRecord in pairs(core.dialogue.journal.records) do
    print(journalRecord.id)
end

--print ids of all journal records
for _, journalRecord in pairs(core.dialogue.journal.records) do
    print(journalRecord.id)
end

--print quest names for all quests the player has inside a player script
for _, quest in pairs(types.Player.quests(self)) do
    print(quest.id, core.dialogue.journal.records[quest.id].questName)
end

--print quest names for all quests the player has inside a player script
for _, quest in pairs(types.Player.quests(self)) do
    print(quest.id, core.dialogue.journal.records[quest.id].questName)
end

content.paragraph: Depending on which store this read-only dialogue record is from, it may either be a journal, topic, greeting, persuasion or voice.

content.code: local questName = core.dialogue.journal.records['A2_4_MiloGone'].questName -- "Mehra Milo and the Lost Prophecies"
local questName = core.dialogue.journal.records['A2_4_MiloGone'].questName -- "Mehra Milo and the Lost Prophecies"

content.paragraph: Record identifier A read-only list containing all#DialogueRecordInfos for this record, in order. Same as id, but with upper cases preserved. Non-nil only for journal records with available value. Holds the quest name for this journal entry. Same info may be available underinfos[1].textas well, but this variable is made for convenience.

Holds the read-only data for one of many info entries inside a dialogue record. Depending on the type of the dialogue record (journal, topic, greeting, persuasion or voice), it could be, for example, a single journal entry or a NPC dialogue line.

content.code:
--Variable `aa` below is "Congratulations, %PCName. You are now %PCName the %NextPCRank." in vanilla MW:
local aa = core.dialogue.topic.records['advancement'].infos[100].text

--Variable `aa` below is "Congratulations, %PCName. You are now %PCName the %NextPCRank." in vanilla MW:
local aa = core.dialogue.topic.records['advancement'].infos[100].text

--Variable `bb` below is "sound/vo/a/f/fle_af003.mp3" in vanilla MW:
local bb = core.dialogue.voice.records['flee'].infos[149].sound

--Variable `bb` below is "sound/vo/a/f/fle_af003.mp3" in vanilla MW:
local bb = core.dialogue.voice.records['flee'].infos[149].sound

content.paragraph:
Speaker class allowing for this info entry to appear. Always nil for journal records. Otherwise the nil value represents no conditions, i.e. no filtering applied using these criteria. Minimum speaker disposition allowing for this info entry to appear. Always nil for journal records. Otherwise is a nonnegative number, with the zero value representing no conditions, i.e. no filtering applied using these criteria. Faction of which the speaker must be a member for this info entry to appear. Always nil for journal records. Otherwise the nil value represents no conditions, i.e. no filtering applied using these criteria.
Can return an empty string - this means that the actor must not be a member of any faction for this filtering to apply. Minimum speaker's rank in their faction allowing for this info entry to appear. Always nil for journal records. Otherwise the nil value represents no conditions, i.e. no filtering applied using these criteria.
Rank index starts from 1, matching the value inopenmw_types#NPC.getFactionRank Speaker gender allowing for this info entry to appear: "male" or "female". Always nil for journal records. Otherwise the nil value represents no conditions, i.e. no filtering applied using these criteria. Speaker ID allowing for this info entry to appear. Always nil for journal records. Otherwise the nil value represents no conditions, i.e. no filtering applied using these criteria. Speaker race allowing for this info entry to appear. Always nil for journal records. Otherwise the nil value represents no conditions, i.e. no filtering applied using these criteria. Cell name prefix of location where the player must be for this info entry to appear. Always nil for journal records. Otherwise the nil value represents no conditions, i.e. no filtering applied using these criteria.
"Prefix" means that the cell's name starting with this value shall pass the filtering. For example:filterPlayerCellbeing "Seyda Neen" does apply to the cell "Seyda Neen, Fargoth's House".

Faction of which the player must be a member for this info entry to appear. Always nil for journal records. Otherwise the nil value represents no conditions, i.e. no filtering applied using these criteria. Minimum player's rank in their faction allowing for this info entry to appear. Always nil for journal records. Otherwise the nil value represents no conditions, i.e. no filtering applied using these criteria.
Rank index starts from 1, matching the value inopenmw_types#NPC.getFactionRank Identifier for this info entry. Is unique only within the#DialogueRecordit belongs to. True if this info entry has the "Finished" flag checked. Non-nil only for journal records. True if this info entry has the "Quest Name" flag checked. Non-nil only for journal records.
If true, then the#DialogueRecord, to which this info entry belongs, should have this info entry'sDialogueRecordInfo.textvalue available in itsDialogueRecord.questName. True if this info entry has the "Restart" flag checked. Non-nil only for journal records. Quest stage (same as inopenmw_types#PlayerQuest.stage) this info entry is associated with. Non-nil only for journal records. MWScript (full script text) executed when this info is chosen. Always nil for journal records or if there is no value set. Sound file path for this info entry. Always nil for journal records or if there is no sound set. Text associated with this info entry.
A read-only list of all#DialogueRecords in the world database, may be indexed by recordId, which doesn't have to be lowercase. Implementsiterables#Listof #DialogueRecord.
Map from#MagicEffectIdto#MagicEffect

-- Print all harmful effects
for _, effect in pairs(core.magic.effects.records) do
    if effect.harmful then
        print(effect.name)
    end
end

-- Print all harmful effects
for _, effect in pairs(core.magic.effects.records) do
    if effect.harmful then
        print(effect.name)
    end
end

-- Look up the record of a specific effect and print its icon
local mgef = core.magic.effects.records[core.magic.EFFECT_TYPE.Reflect]
print('Reflect Icon: '..tostring(mgef.icon))

-- Look up the record of a specific effect and print its icon
local mgef = core.magic.effects.records[core.magic.EFFECT_TYPE.Reflect]
print('Reflect Icon: '..tostring(mgef.icon))

-- Getting the enchantment of an arbitrary item, if it has one
local function getRecord(item)
    if item.type and item.type.record then
        return item.type.record(item)
    end
    return nil
end
local function getEnchantment(item)
    local record = getRecord(item)
    if record and record.enchant then
        return core.magic.enchantments.records[record.enchant]
    end
    return nil
end

-- Getting the enchantment of an arbitrary item, if it has one
local function getRecord(item)
    if item.type and item.type.record then
        return item.type.record(item)
    end
    return nil
end
local function getEnchantment(item)
    local record = getRecord(item)
    if record and record.enchant then
        return core.magic.enchantments.records[record.enchant]
    end
    return nil
end

Enchantment is cast on strike, if there is enough charge. Enchantment is cast when used, if there is enough charge. Enchantment can be cast once, destroying the enchanted item. Enchantment is always active when equipped.

content.paragraph: Faction rank data record

Attributes values required to get this rank. Reaction of faction members if player is in this faction. Secondary skill value required to get this rank. Faction name Rank display name Primary skill value required to get this rank.
Faction data record

A read-only list containing IDs of attributes to advance ranks in the faction. If true, the faction won't show in the player's skills menu Faction id Faction name A read-only list containing data for all ranks in the faction, in order. A read-only map containing reactions of other factions to this faction. A read-only list containing IDs of skills to advance ranks in the faction.
A read-only list of all#FactionRecords in the world database.
Any object that exists in the game world and has a specific location. Player, actors, items, and statics are game objects.
Activate the object.

#GameObjectactor: 
The actor who activates the object

Add new local script to the object. Can be called only from a global script. Script should be specified in a content
file (omwgame/omwaddon/omwscripts) with a CUSTOM flag. Scripts can not be attached to Statics.

#string scriptPath: 
Path to the script in OpenMW virtual filesystem.

#table initData: 
(optional) Initialization data to be passed to onInit. If missed then Lua initialization data from content files will be used (if exists for this script).
The cell where the object currently is. During loading a game and for objects in an inventory or a containercellis nil.

Lower cased file name of the content file that defines this object; nil for dynamically created objects. Count (>1 means a stack of objects). Whether the object is enabled or disabled. Global scripts can set the value. Items in containers or inventories can't be disabled. The axis aligned bounding box in world coordinates.
openmw.util#Box: Global Variable associated with this object(read only). Whether a script with given path is attached to this object. Can be called only from a global script.

#string scriptPath: 
Path to the script in OpenMW virtual filesystem.

#boolean: A unique id of this object (not record id), can be used as a key in a table. Does the object still exist and is available. Returns true if the object exists and loaded, and false otherwise. If false, then every
access to the object will raise an error.

#boolean: Moves object into a container or an inventory. Enables if was disabled.
Can be called only from a global script.
#any dest:#Inventoryor#GameObject

Ownership information Container or actor that contains (or has in inventory) this object. It is nil if the object is in a cell. Object position. Returns record ID of the object in lowercase. Removes an object or reduces a stack of objects. Can be called only from a global script.

#number count: 
(optional) the number of items to remove (if not specified then the whole stack)
Removes script that was attached byaddScriptCan be called only from a global script.

#string scriptPath: 
Path to the script in OpenMW virtual filesystem.
Object rotation. Object scale. Send local event to the object.
#string eventName:
eventData:
Sets the object's scale. Can be called only from a global script.

#number scale: 
Scale desired in game.

Splits a stack of items. Original stack is reduced bycount. Returns a new stack withcountitems.
Can be called only from a global script.

The number of items to return.

content.paragraph:
The object original position The object original rotation Moves object to given cell and position. Can be called only from a global script.
The effect is not immediate: the position will be updated only in the next
frame. Can be called only from a global script. Enables object if it was disabled.
Can be used to move objects from an inventory or a container to the world.

#any cellOrName: 
A cell to define the destination worldspace; can be either #Cell, or cell name, or an empty string (empty string means the default exterior worldspace).
If the worldspace has multiple cells (i.e. an exterior), the destination cell is calculated usingposition.

New position.

#boolean:
Will resolve the inventory, filling it with levelled items if applicable, making its contents permanent. Must be used in a global script.
Possible#MagicEffectIdvalues Possible#EnchantmentTypevalues Possible#SpellRangevalues Possible#SpellTypevalues #Effects: Magic Effects #Enchantments: Enchantments #Spells: Spells

Identifier of the sound used for AOE spells Identifier of the vfx static used for AOE spells Identifier of the projectile used for ranged spells Identifier of the projectile sound used for ranged spells Identifier of the sound used for casting Identifier of the vfx static used for casting If set, it is implied the magic effect links back to the caster in some way and should end immediately or never be applied if the caster dies or is not an actor. Whether the magic effect's vfx should loop or not If set, the effect is considered harmful and should elicit a hostile reaction from affected NPCs. If set, the magic effect has a duration. As an example, divine intervention has no duration while fire damage does. If set, the magic effect depends on a magnitude. As an example, cure common disease has no magnitude while chameleon does. Identifier of the sound used on hit Identifier of the vfx static used on hit Effect Icon Path Effect ID If set, the magic effect is applied fully on cast, rather than being continuously applied over the effect's duration. For example, chameleon is applied once, while fire damage is continuously applied for the duration. Localized name of the effect If set, this effect cannot be re-applied until it has ended. This is used by bound equipment spells. Identifier of the particle texture Skill ID that is this effect's school
